headline: Gold rallies to new record on U.S. rate cut hopes, Fed tension
summary: Gold hit a record high above $3,600 an ounce on Tuesday, spurred by expectations of U.S. rate cuts, concerns about Federal Reserve independence and robust demand from investors and central banks.  Having hit a record high at $3,673.95 a troy ounce, spot gold was trading around $3,637.39 at 1524 GMT for a gain of more than 38% so far this year.  A Reuters survey published in July showed analysts expected gold prices to average $3,220 this year compared with $3,065 in the April survey and $2,756 an ounce in the January survey.

headline: CME Group Launches Analytics to Empower Volatility Traders In Increasingly Active Options Market
summary: CME Group, the world's leading derivatives marketplace, today announced it will provide market participants with enhanced tools to analyze options market data, facilitating more informed trading strategies and risk management.

raw.headline: CME Group Launches Analytics to Empower Volatility Traders In Increasingly Active Options Market
raw.summary: CME Group, the world's leading derivatives marketplace, today announced it will provide market participants with enhanced tools to analyze options market data, facilitating more informed trading strategies and risk management.

headline: Gold price hits another record high as US rate cut expectations rise
summary: Bullion extends blistering rally as investors price in a near-certain rate cut by the US Federal Reserve.

raw.headline: Gold price hits another record high as US rate cut expectations rise
raw.summary: Bullion extends blistering rally as investors price in a near-certain rate cut by the US Federal Reserve.

headline: FTSE rises and Wall Street muted as Qatar hit by Israeli airstrikes
summary: Israel launched an attack on senior Hamas members meeting in Doha, reportedly including the group’s chief negotiator.
